subject: Rant: assertEquals(String, String) -- strdiff'ing is a bad idea
msgSnippet: It is often the case that when something breaks, several long strings are programatically passed to assertEquals(), one of which is off by one character,

Subject: Rant: assertEquals(String, String) -- strdiff'ing is a bad idea

It is often the case that when something breaks, several
long strings are p=
rogramatically passed to assertEquals(),
one of which is off by one charact=
er, sometimes a
whitespace character.

The code which tries to be clever an=
d do a diff basically
makes the error message quite useless, because it is
=
impossible to tell which line caused the error, or where
the error is.

e.g=
.

String TESTIN=3D { ...
"Junit can get too clever for its own good"
...};=


String TESTOUT=3D { ...
"Junit can get too  clever for its own good"
...}=
;


[...]
for (int i=3D0; i<TESTIN.length; i++) {
  assertEquals(TESTIN[i],=
 TESTOUT[i]);
}

=3D>  junit.framework.ComparisonFailure: expected:<... ...=
> but was:<......>

There's no way to see what really happened now.
If the =
simple approach of just printing out the
entire message was retained, it ma=
kes it more
usable.

Yes, I could always append the actual and expected
str=
ings to the message and do it that way -- but
that's just a pointlessly unp=
leasant way to do it :)

-kb
